subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology
subSections.text: Generally thought to derive from a Korean dialectal term for the fish, which would have entered Japanese as {{l|ja|松}}{{l|ja|魚}} (''matsu no uo'', "pine fish", possibly in reference to wooded streams where it can be caught), combining with or being influenced by the verb {{l|ja|増す}} (''masu'', "to be [[excellent]], [[superior]]", in reference to the size, flavor, and other favorable characteristics of the fish).

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ます|マス}}

# [[trout]], [[sea trout]]: more specifically, fish belonging to [[genera]] of the [[family]] ''[[Salmonidae]]'': ''[[Salmo]]'', ''[[Oncorhynchus]]'', ''[[Coregonus]]'', or ''[[Salvelinus]]''
